channel.title: RSCEssentials
channel.description:
So I created Object Generator, just a week back or so... and sure it has been handy but not handy enough! First off you can only generate objectloc.xml codes... This newest version and re-named version RSCEssentials will allow you to choose what code you want to generate anywhere from Object, NPC Loc, Shop Loc, to item loc...
It will also have ID's of NPC's, Item's and objects along with guides to help you understand some things related to what we offer in the RSCEssentials!
The interface will undergo a huge change and a new look as i'm taking my time with this one, using photoshop & better programming approaches. So heres a look at the future program I'll be releasing if you would like a better understanding, scroll down and check out my object generator it's going to be that but much much more!
[img]http://i49.tinypic.com/jzk17t.jpg[/img]
Now take a look at the first version lol...
Which can be found here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,597037.0.html
[img]http://i47.tinypic.com/kbvf68.jpg[/img]
[size=24pt][b]UPDATE:[/b][/size]
[img]http://i45.tinypic.com/mj48y.jpg[/img]
[b]And heres a sampler for you guys:[/b] 2.27KB small install, installs quick and goes into the start menu.
[b]Download Sample:[/b] http://uppit.com/lm870bxzx9bu/RSCEssentials.zip

item.title: RSCEssentials
item.dc:creator: @its2013 its2013
item.description:
@its2013 wrote:

Thats nice, but mine does the same basic thing except you have to punch in a few digits… Copy n paste it to your xml and archive it.

Ive got the object generator done, its pretty nice. Moving onto NPC, Items and shops… Prolly finish it up next weekend since i got work mon-fri

Read full topic

item.title: RSCEssentials
item.dc:creator: @q3ase q3ase
item.description:
@q3ase wrote:

[quote=“Wife Beater, post:4, topic:480323”][quote author=q3ase link=topic=598558.msg4209359#msg4209359 date=1359327481]
To be honest it be easier to add commands in game and generate it from there.

Or use vrunk’s? npc mapper. What you just clicked on the map and boom.
[/quote]

Could you link that for us? I cant find it anywhere :([/quote]http://www.rscdump.com/XML-editor.rar

Read full topic

item.title: RSCEssentials
item.dc:creator: @its2013 its2013
item.description:
@its2013 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

You’re going to need to add onto a 3d landscaper… being able to add entities onto the map in realtime would be far more superior.

Shit if I were able to do so, I would… But see i’m not good enough to do realtime editing yet ill continue to program and improve RSCEssentials and hopefully i’ll come up with something. I think a realtime editor would have to be written in java.

Probably use a client, with a server side that would be connected to local host at all times… have a few menus in the client with options to edit, and automatically save the locs,defs, etc… it would be sweet… then afterwards press compile and it would compile it all to your client & server folder…

And anyhow i’m going to continue to work on this which it might be easier to add a command in game, but im not how you would be able to? So my approach is making a program that has more then one feature, and is loaded with information and guides to help you out.

Read full topic
